channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: @webology i know about these products, but i want the electric company to send me an email at least every month. it's not just my bill i want to optimize, i think we should all get an upgrade.

Putin wants respect as a superpower. He wants us to think about him as daunting and menacing. He didn't know, after the election of 2016, he had us exactly where he wanted us. But his military apparently was his weakness. He should have kept that hidden.

1/7 Here's an idea of how to cut fuel consumption for electricity.
2/7 My electric bill has been going up, dramatically. Not sure how much this is due to rising energy cost, or my purchase of a Tesla electric car last year, or something else. I use electricity for lots of things. More all the time.
3/7 What's the difference in cost between keeping the thermostat at 65 vs 60? Maybe it's insignificant, or maybe it's very significant. I have no idea.
4/7 I have no tools to tell me what my electric consumption is graphed over time. If I did, I could for example, unplug the car and see how much the consumption goes down. Or turn down the thermostat to 60 and see what happens.
5/7 Who knows what my car is doing when I'm not watching? It has a mind of its own. Not like old cars that did nothing when they're turned off, my Tesla is always waking up and doing stuff. I bet that uses energy.
6/7 Maybe one of my devices is somehow malfunctioning and using a lot of energy and I could reduce consumption by replacing it, or leave it turned off unless I'm using it.
7/7 We're all flying blind. Let's create the tools to optimize energy use. I bet it would save a lot of money and be a good way to cut energy consumption.
RSS apps should be left in place because they are a vital part of information flow on the internet. https://t.co/JJMcXCMw0o
Tens of thousands join rallies around the world in support of Ukraine. https://t.co/KzSn0npRhY
Longtime Hudson Valley restaurants close doors for good. https://t.co/ps3OJDDMmV
Just caught up on round the clock coverage of Ukraine and it’s gotten into a short loop about the implications of no fly zones and the character of Putin. People being interviewed seem exhausted.
The Emptiness Inside Donald Trump’s New Social Media Platform. https://t.co/1ToQjClwrd
@GuyESchilling Yeah, the libs were his engine. Without the libs who does he get to annoy? That was his whole schtick.
BTW, the reason RSS has been so impervious to replacement is also explained by this piece about how the web wiped out advances in text editing In the PC/Mac markets. https://t.co/dwVzdKyEwo
I kind of feel sorry for Carmelo Anthony. The Lakers are like the Knicks, except with superstars. Kind of like the Nets. I told you this superteam idea was bogus. https://t.co/C9ePu4n6ZW

Journalism is self-governing. Responsible to no one but itself. Journalism is its own journalism, and not surprisingly that means no journalism. Imagine any other industry or organization that could make sure it never gets bad press. That is the problem with journalism.

Get lucky and this little baby deer was running in front of my camera when I was ready to take a video so that’s what I did. https://t.co/DxoNSl2hHs
I think this might be the best video I've ever made. Just luck and a great camera.
Great Barrier Reef devastation. https://t.co/HpQ56E6r4q

@erinbiba @TaylorLorenz @maggieNYT @MarkMazzettiNYT @jdawsey1 @GregJaffe @JaxAlemany Reporters in general only listen to other reporters. And NYT reporters in general (again) are even worse, they only respect other NYT reporters. Our experience is irrelevant. Taylor will object, she's wonderful and the exception to all the rules.
@nytherapy right, that's the problem.
Evolution in software. https://t.co/dwVzdKyEwo
@jeffjarvis Jeff, my reply was too long to fit in a tweet. https://t.co/r72RqoTxuy

Now is a time for news sources that might be cut off to start using RSS seriously because that would allow others to mirror their content, and make it possible to get it back online with just a DNS change.
People thought we were being too idealistic when it was said that a benefit of syndication is that it helps route around censorship. Now in 2022, that's a very real thing. Such an inexpensive insurance policy to help make sure the news gets out.

@workout_fox that makes sense for the 60s and 70s, in Germany, but the distinction today is not significant and it suggests to readers that there's something new an innovative. Maybe these are the "nice" Nazis. The point is they don't deserve any qualifiers, a Nazi is just a Nazi.
@workout_fox what was the difference between them?

The term "neo-Nazis" should be deprecated. Nazis are Nazis, nothing neo about them.
Listening to an NPR story where they say neo-Nazi over and over again. I'd like to ask the reporter what's the difference.
